pageContext.claim: “Keep in mind, those who apply for asylum, legally, at ports of entry, are not prosecuted. The fake news media back there doesn't talk about that.”
pageContext.analysis: U.S. ports of entry are often overcrowded, and there have been numerous reports of immigrants seeking asylum being turned away. Furthermore, U.S. law allows qualified applicants to petition for asylum regardless of whether they crossed through a port of entry.
